briefdescription.para: Vector of vectors of vectors of doubles.
Vector of vectors of vectors of floats.
Vector of vectors of vectors of longs.
Vector of vectors of vectors of integers.
Vector of vectors of unsigned long longs.
Vector of vectors of vectors of unsigned long longs.
Vector of vectors of vectors of booleans.
Vector of vectors of unsigned integers.
Vector of vectors of vectors of unsigned integers.
Vector of vectors of vectors of characters.
Defines data types and structures for handling various data formats.

detaileddescription.para:
This enumeration represents different data types that can be processed within the framework, including scalar types and various vector containers. The prefix indicates the dimensionality:
v_* for scalar values or 1D vectors
vv_* for 2D vectors (vectors of vectors)
vvv_* for 3D vectors (vectors of vectors of vectors)

briefdescription.para: AdamW optimizer (Adam with weight decay regularization)
Defines available optimizer types for machine learning models.

detaileddescription.para: This enumeration represents different optimization algorithms that can be used for training machine learning models within the framework.

briefdescription.para: Xavier/Glorot initialization, balancing signal variance across layers.
Kaiming/He initialization, particularly good for ReLU activations.
Binary Cross Entropy with Logits loss.
Defines various loss functions for training machine learning models.

detaileddescription.para: This enumeration represents different loss functions that can be used to optimize machine learning models during training.

briefdescription.para: Defines different components or aspects of a graph structure.

detaileddescription.para: This enumeration represents various elements of a graph that can be processed or analyzed separately, such as nodes, edges, or the graph as a whole.

briefdescription.para: Defines operational modes for the framework.

detaileddescription.para: This enumeration represents different modes in which the framework can operate.

briefdescription.para: Defines properties of particles in a physics simulation.

detaileddescription.para: This enumeration represents various attributes of particles that can be used in simulations or analyses.
